etymologies: late 19th century: American Spanish, from Maya yaaj ‘wound, poison’ + té ‘mouth’ with reference to its caustic properties

definitions: a tropical American plant of the arum family that is cultivated for its edible tubers and sometimes its leaves.

notes.text: Genus Xanthosoma, family Araceae: several species, in particular the fleshy-leaved malanga (X. atrovirens) of Latin America

shortDefinitions: tropical American plant of arum family which is cultivated for its edible tubers
